etymology.interpretation: The character 帶(帶) (dài, "carry") represents a belt or sash used to hold or carry things. This aligns well with its meanings related to bringing or carrying items, akin to how a belt holds items close to the body.
etymology.simplification: 带(帶): The character was retained for its pictographic meaning and was not altered despite being used in simplified form with the same structure.

examples.chinese: 他带着书包去上学(他帶著書包去上學)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dài zhe shūbāo qù shàng xué.
examples.english: He carries his schoolbag to school.

examples.chinese: 妈妈带苹果回家(媽媽帶蘋果回家)，准备做水果沙拉(準備做水果沙拉)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā dài píngguǒ huí jiā, zhǔnbèi zuò shuǐguǒ shālā.
examples.english: Mom brings apples home and prepares to make a fruit salad.

examples.chinese: 他腰间系着一条皮带(他腰間系著一條皮帶)，显得非常精神(顯得非常精神)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yāojiān xì zhe yītiáo pídài, xiǎn de fēicháng jīngshén.
examples.english: He fastens a belt around his waist and looks very energetic.
